moves.3... d6 4. a4 Bg4 5. Bb5+ Bd7 6. b4: Blundering a pawn. After 6.... cxb4 7. cxb4 Qxb4 white has nothing, and still has to defend the pawn on e4
moves.7. h3: Quite unnecessary. Perhaps 0-0 should have been considered, with d4 in mind
moves.7... Bxb5 8. axb5 cxb4 9. Qb3 a6 10. Qxb: Look how fast it gets crazy. Should have castled!!
moves.12... Qc6 13. d3 e5: The antipositional thrust e5, a move that has not been refuted to date in these Sicilian type positions
moves.14. Qe3 a4: What is the idea behind this move? Perhaps sanity was better with Be7 and 0-0
moves.15... Ra6: Black wants to munch pawns at the expense of his development
moves.18... d5: Black breaking in the centre while his development is incomplete.....what a recipe!
moves.19... Qxc3+ 20. Ke2: No castling now for white. Black should aim to get his king away from the centre quickly
moves.22... Re6 23. Rhc1 Qxe4: And blunders the queen lol! What does he have after Nxe4? Yeah....you got that right.... precisely NOTHING!!
